To fight for a new social contract in Europe. Speaking in a moment to the CC of the Council of Europe https://t.co/NL6iEIa8F8
Democratic citizens do not forget the great support provided by the Council of Europe to the struggling Greece during the dictatorship.
The protective provisions of the Revised European Social Charter indicate the way for a sustainable common course of peoples and states.
Our country, after unacceptable delays, ratified the European Social Charter of 1961 twenty-three years later 1/2
and the Revised European Social Charter of 1996, twenty years later. And this, at the initiative of our own government. 2/2
Greece is now in need of an institutional reorganization of the already flexible labor market and not its full leveling.
Irrespective of the verdict of the British people, we need to reflect on the borderline of Europe.
Restoring investment confidence requires visible and binding steps to restore public debt to a viable track.
With its failure, neo-liberal crisis management fueled the monster of nationalism and far-right and fascist populism.
Shifting direction, acting collectively, without impersonal leaderships and obsessions, reaffirming the founding principles of the EU.
In the last period, Greece was at the center of the largest refugee & immigration crisis in Europe after the Second World War.
In 2015, our authorities carried out over 170,000 rescues, many of which related to babies, children, people from vulnerable groups.
RT @ Ollanta_HumalaT: The government promulgates the Law of Search for Missing Persons, in an effort to give justice to affected families ...
We will make a proposal to the Commission that unaccompanied children under 10 years of age are trapped in Greece 1/2
before 19 March, be included as a priority in the relocation program to other EU countries. 2/2
RT @UN_PGA: Global Nutrition Report from @WHO outlines the scale of malnutrition in 2016 https://t.co/fvjkiw5MDj https://t.co/8NKN1MVh1a
Only together in Europe, together with the countries of transit and of origin, can we deal with the refugee crisis.
The defense of fundamental rights in Greece requires crosscuts that we did not hesitate to carry out.
We have changed the Citizenship Act by taking care of the procedures for granting Greek citizenship to second-generation immigrant children.
We have already made legislation to improve the situation in prisons, reducing, by a recent law, overpopulation.
We plan interconnection of prisons with the National Health System and development of drug treatment structures.
We have established the National Policy Monitoring Mechanism for Roma and we are proceeding directly with the establishment of a Special Secretariat.
We are proceeding - in the next period - to the construction of a mosque and a Muslim cemetery in Athens.
Greece, considering that the role of the Council of Europe, as an unifying force based on shared values ​​and principles, 1/2
is irreplaceable, has contributed and will continue to contribute with all its might to the achievement of its goals. 2/2
